intro: Couepia oxossii, commonly known as the Oaxaca couepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Mexico, specifically the state of Oaxaca, where it grows in tropical dry forests and shrublands. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in well-drained soils and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Couepia oxossii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
